metadata.title: Virus Oligo Name Sequence (5'-3') Role Study

body_text.text: . Results of all study samples screened for 12 polyomaviruses stratified by subject, month of collection posttransplant (DoC), and sample type. Red = blood, yellow = urine, green = combined nose & throat swab. All detection shown as genomic copies per mL of sample. <LoQ = Below the limit of quantitation. *Standard curves were applied retrospecively to previous JCV and BKV detection data, and as such viral loads should be taken only as apporximate values. 0.1 9 0.9 9 2.8 9 5.8 9

BIBREF0.title: Specific rolling circle amplification of low-copy human polyomaviruses BKV, HPyV6, HPyV7, TSPyV, and STLPyV

TABREF0.text: Primer and probe sequences for real-time PCRs used in the study. EHV was used solely for extraction quality control.Korup S, Rietscher J, Calvignac-Spencer S, Trusch F, Hofmann J, Moens U, Sauer I, Voigt S, Schmuck R, Ehlers B. 2013. Identification of a novel human polyomavirus in organs of the gastrointestinal tract. PLoS One 8:e58021. Bialasiewicz S, Whiley DM, Buhrer-Skinner M, Bautista C, Barker K, Aitken S, Gordon R, Muller R, Lambert SB, Debattista J, Nissen MD, Sloots TP. 2009. A novel gel-based method for selfcollection and ambient temperature postal transport of urine for PCR detection of Chlamydia Pal A, Sirota L, Maudru T, Peden K, Lewis AM. Real-time, quantitative PCR assays for the detection of virus-specific DNA in samples with mixed populations of polyomaviruses. J Virol Methods. 2006 Jul;135(1):32-42. Hoffman NG, Cook L, Atienza EE, Limaye AP, Jerome KR. Marked variability of BK virus load measurement using quantitative real-time PCR among commonly used assays. J Clin Microbiol.
